member.summary: For working with dynamic.
For working with concrete types.

member.name: T:Cesil.Configuration
member.summary: Used to combine a type and an Options into a BoundConfiguration(T), which can create readers and writers.

member.name: M:Cesil.Configuration.ForDynamic
member.summary: Create a new IBoundConfiguration(T) with default Options, for use with dynamic types.

member.name: M:Cesil.Configuration.ForDynamic(Cesil.Options)
member.summary: Create a new IBoundConfiguration(T) with given Options, for use with dynamic types.

member.name: M:Cesil.Configuration.For``1
member.summary: Create a new IBoundConfiguration(T) with default Options, for use with the given type.

member.name: M:Cesil.Configuration.For``1(Cesil.Options)
member.summary: Create a new IBoundConfiguration(T) with the given Options, for use with the given type.

member.name: T:Cesil.DynamicRowDisposal
member.summary: When a dynamic row returned by a IReader or IAsyncReader will be disposed.

member.name: F:Cesil.DynamicRowDisposal.None
member.summary: Default value, do not use.

member.name: F:Cesil.DynamicRowDisposal.OnReaderDispose
member.summary: Dynamic rows will be automatically disposed when the reader that returned them is disposed.

member.name: F:Cesil.DynamicRowDisposal.OnExplicitDispose
member.summary: Dynamic rows will only be disposed when Dispose() is explicitly called on the row.

member.name: T:Cesil.IBoundConfiguration`1
member.summary:
Represents and Options and Type pair.
Used to create readers and writers.

member.name: M:Cesil.IBoundConfiguration`1.CreateReader(System.IO.TextReader,System.Object)
member.summary:
Create a synchronous reader for the given reader.
Takes an optional context object which is made available during certain operations as a member on ReadContext.

member.name: M:Cesil.IBoundConfiguration`1.CreateAsyncReader(System.IO.TextReader,System.Object)
member.summary:
Create an asynchronous reader for the given reader.
Takes an optional context object which is made available during certain operations as a member on ReadContext.

member.name: M:Cesil.IBoundConfiguration`1.CreateWriter(System.IO.TextWriter,System.Object)
member.summary:
Create a synchronous writer for the given writer.
Takes an optional context object which is made available during certain operations as a member on WriteContext.

member.name: M:Cesil.IBoundConfiguration`1.CreateAsyncWriter(System.IO.TextWriter,System.Object)
member.summary:
Create an asynchronous writer for the given writer.
Takes an optional context object which is made available during certain operations as a member on WriteContext.

member.name: T:Cesil.Options
member.summary:
A set of options for reading and writing CSV files.
Combine with Configuration to bind to a particular type in a Configuration(T) which can create readers and writers.

member.name: F:Cesil.Options.Default
member.summary: Default options: - separator = , - row endings = \r\n - escaped columns start = " - escape character = " - detects headers when reading - writes headers - uses the default type describer - uses MemoryPool.Shared - uses the default write buffer size - does not write a new line after the last row - does not support comments - uses the default read buffer size - dynamic rows are disposed when the reader that returns them is disposed

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.ValueSeparator
member.summary:
Character used to separate two values in a row
Typically a comma.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.EscapedValueStartAndEnd
member.summary:
Character used to start an escaped value.
Typically a double quote.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.EscapedValueEscapeCharacter
member.summary:
Character used to escape another character in an escaped value.
Typically a double quote.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.RowEnding
member.summary: The sequence of characters used to end a row.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.ReadHeader
member.summary: Whether or not to read headers when reading a CSV.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.WriteHeader
member.summary: Whether or not to write headers when writing a CSV.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.TypeDescriber
member.summary: The instance of ITypeDescriber that will be used to discover which columns to read or write, as well as the manner of their reading and writing.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.WriteTrailingNewLine
member.summary: Whether or not to write a new line after the last row in a CSV.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.MemoryPool
member.summary: Which MemoryPool to use when reading or writing a CSV.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.CommentCharacter
member.summary:
Which character, if any, is used to indicate the start of a comment.
Typically not set, but when set often the octothorpe.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.WriteBufferSizeHint
member.summary:
How big a buffer to request from the MemoryPool for buffering write operations.
Set to 0 to disable buffering.
Set to null to use a default size.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.ReadBufferSizeHint
member.summary:
How big a buffer to request from the MemoryPool for servicing read operations.
Set to 0 to use a default size.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.DynamicTypeConverter
member.summary: The instance of IDynamicTypeConverter that will be used to determine how to convert dynamic rows and cells into concrete types.

member.name: P:Cesil.Options.DynamicRowDisposal
member.summary: When to dispose any dynamic rows returned by an IReader or IAsyncReader.

member.name: M:Cesil.Options.NewEmptyBuilder
member.summary: Create a new, empty, OptionsBuilder.

member.name: M:Cesil.Options.NewBuilder
member.summary: Create a new OptionsBuilder that copies its initial values from this Options.

member.name: T:Cesil.OptionsBuilder
member.summary:
Builder for Options.
Options itself is immutable, but OptionsBuilder is chainable and mutable.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.ValueSeparator
member.summary:
Character used to separate two values in a row
Typically a comma.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.EscapedValueStartAndEnd
member.summary:
Character used to start an escaped value.
Typically a double quote.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.EscapedValueEscapeCharacter
member.summary:
Character used to escape another character in an escaped value.
Typically a double quote.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.RowEnding
member.summary: The sequence of characters used to end a row.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.ReadHeader
member.summary: Whether or not to read headers when reading a CSV.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WriteHeader
member.summary: Whether or not to write headers when writing a CSV.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.TypeDescriber
member.summary: The instance of ITypeDescriber that will be used to discover which columns to read or write, as well as the manner of their reading and writing.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WriteTrailingNewLine
member.summary: Whether or not to write a new line after the last row in a CSV.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.MemoryPool
member.summary: Which MemoryPool to use when reading or writing a CSV.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.CommentCharacter
member.summary:
Which character, if any, is used to indicate the start of a comment.
Typically not set, but when set often the octothorpe.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WriteBufferSizeHint
member.summary:
How big a buffer to request from the MemoryPool for buffering write operations.
Set to 0 to disable buffering.
Set to null to use a default size.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.ReadBufferSizeHint
member.summary:
How big a buffer to request from the MemoryPool for servicing read operations.
Set to 0 to use a default size.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.DynamicTypeConverter
member.summary: The instance of IDynamicTypeConverter that will be used to determine how to convert dynamic rows and cells into concrete types.

member.name: P:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.DynamicRowDisposal
member.summary: When to dispose any dynamic rows returned by an IReader or IAsyncReader.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.NewEmptyBuilder
member.summary: Create a new, empty, OptionsBuilder.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.Build
member.summary: Create the Options object that has been configured by this builder.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithValueSeparator(System.Char)
member.summary: Set the character used to separate two values in a row.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithEscapedValueStartAndEnd(System.Char)
member.summary: Set the character used to start an escaped value.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithEscapedValueEscapeCharacter(System.Char)
member.summary: Set the character used to escape another character in an escaped value.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithRowEnding(Cesil.RowEndings)
member.summary: Set the sequence of characters that will end a row.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithReadHeader(Cesil.ReadHeaders)
member.summary: Set whether or not to read headers.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithWriteHeader(Cesil.WriteHeaders)
member.summary: Set whether or not to write headers.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithTypeDescriber(Cesil.ITypeDescriber)
member.summary: Set the ITypeDescriber used to discover and configure the columns that are read and written.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithDynamicTypeConverter(Cesil.IDynamicTypeConverter)
member.summary: Set the ITypeDescriber used to discover and configure the columns that are read and written.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithWriteTrailingNewLine(Cesil.WriteTrailingNewLines)
member.summary: Set whether or not to end the last row with a new line.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithMemoryPool(System.Buffers.MemoryPool{System.Char})
member.summary: Set the MemoryPool used during reading and writing.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithCommentCharacter(System.Nullable{System.Char})
member.summary: Set or clear the character that starts a row that is a comment.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithWriteBufferSizeHint(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Set or clear the buffer size hint for write operations.
Setting it to null will cause a default "best guess" buffer to be requested from the configured MemoryPool.
Setting it to 0 will disable buffering.
All values are treated as hints, it's up to the configured MemoryPool to satsify the request.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithReadBufferSizeHint(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the buffer size hint for read operations.
Setting to 0 will cause a default "best guess" size to be requested from the configured MemoryPool.
All values are treated as hints, it's up to the configured MemoryPool to satsify the request.

member.name: M:Cesil.OptionsBuilder.WithDynamicRowDisposal(Cesil.DynamicRowDisposal)
member.summary:
Set when dynamic rows returned by a reader are disposed.
The options are either when the reader is disposed (the default) or when the row is explicitly disposed.

member.name: T:Cesil.RowEndings
member.summary:
Which character sequence ends a row.
This can be determined automatically with Detect.

member.name: F:Cesil.RowEndings.None
member.summary: Default value, do not use.

member.name: F:Cesil.RowEndings.CarriageReturn
member.summary: The \r character.

member.name: F:Cesil.RowEndings.LineFeed
member.summary: The \n character.

member.name: F:Cesil.RowEndings.CarriageReturnLineFeed
member.summary: \r\n character sequence.

member.name: F:Cesil.RowEndings.Detect
member.summary: Will probe the CSV and discover which sequence of characters indicates the end of a record.

member.name: T:Cesil.WriteHeaders
member.summary: Whether or not to write a header row when serializing.

member.name: F:Cesil.WriteHeaders.None
member.summary: Default value, do not use.

member.name: F:Cesil.WriteHeaders.Always
member.summary:
The first row written by the writer will be a header row.
Actually writing the row will be deferred until the first row is of data is written, or the writer is disposed.

member.name: F:Cesil.WriteHeaders.Never
member.summary: No header row will be written the writer.

member.name: T:Cesil.WriteTrailingNewLines
member.summary: Whether or not their should be a trailing new line after the last row when serializing.

member.name: F:Cesil.WriteTrailingNewLines.None
member.summary: Default value, do not use.

member.name: F:Cesil.WriteTrailingNewLines.Always
member.summary: After the last record is written, always append an additional new line / row ending.

member.name: F:Cesil.WriteTrailingNewLines.Never
member.summary: Do not write an additional new line / row ending after the last record is written.

member.name: T:Cesil.IAsyncReader`1
member.summary: Interface for an asynchronous reader.

member.name: M:Cesil.IAsyncReader`1.EnumerateAllAsync
member.summary:
Returns an async enumerable that will read and yield one row at a time.
The enumerable will attempt to complete synchronously, but will not block if results are not available.

member.name: M:Cesil.IAsyncReader`1.ReadAllAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Asynchronously reads all rows, storing into the provided list.
into must be non-null, and will be returned wrapped in a ValueTask.
The task will attempt to complete synchronously, but will not block if results are not available.

member.name: M:Cesil.IAsyncReader`1.ReadAllAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Asynchronously reads all rows, returning the entire set at once.
The task will attempt to complete synchronously, but will not block if results are not available.

member.name: M:Cesil.IAsyncReader`1.TryReadAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Try to read a single row asynchronously, returning a ReadResult that indicates success or failure.
The task will attempt to complete synchronously, but will not block if results are not available.

member.name: M:Cesil.IAsyncReader`1.TryReadWithReuseAsync(`0@,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Reads a single row into the existing instance of row, returning a ReadResult that indicates success or failure.
If need be, row will be initialized before this method returns - it will remain in use until the returned ValueTask completes.
Note, it is possible for row to be initialized BUT for the ReadResult to indicate failure. In that case row should be ignored / discarded.
The task will attempt to complete synchronously, but will not block if results are not available.

member.name: T:Cesil.IAsyncWriter`1
member.summary: Interface for writing rows asynchronously.

member.name: M:Cesil.IAsyncWriter`1.WriteAllAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IAsyncEnumerable{`0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Writes all rows enumerated by the given IAsyncEnumerable.
Will complete synchronously if possible, but will not block if all rows are not immediately available or if the underlying sink does not complete immediately.

member.name: M:Cesil.IAsyncWriter`1.WriteAllAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Writes all rows enumerated by the given IEnumerable.
Will complete synchronously if possible, but will not block if the underlying sink does not complete immediately.

member.name: M:Cesil.IAsyncWriter`1.WriteAsync(`0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Write a single row.
Will complete synchronously if possible, but will not block if the underlying sink does not complete immediately.

member.name: T:Cesil.IReader`1
member.summary: Interface for a synchronous reader.

member.name: M:Cesil.IReader`1.ReadAll(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0})
member.summary:
Reads all rows into the provided list, returning the entire set at once.
into must be non-null.

member.name: M:Cesil.IReader`1.ReadAll
member.summary: Reads all rows, returning the entire set at once.

member.name: M:Cesil.IReader`1.EnumerateAll
member.summary: Returns an enumerable that will read and yield one row at a time.

member.name: M:Cesil.IReader`1.TryRead(`0@)
member.summary: Reads a single row, populating row and returning true if a row was available and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Cesil.IReader`1.TryReadWithReuse(`0@)
member.summary:
Reads a single row into the existing instance of row, returning true if a row was available and false otherwise.
Row will be initialized if need be.
Note, it is possible for row to be initialized BUT for this method to return false. In that case row should be ignored / discarded.

member.name: T:Cesil.IWriter`1
member.summary: Interface for synchronously writing rows.

member.name: M:Cesil.IWriter`1.WriteAll(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Write all rows in the provided enumerable.

member.name: M:Cesil.IWriter`1.Write(`0)
member.summary: Write a single row.

member.name: T:Cesil.ReadContext
member.summary: Context object provided during read operations.

member.name: P:Cesil.ReadContext.RowNumber
member.summary: The index of the row being read (0-based).

member.name: P:Cesil.ReadContext.ColumnNumber
member.summary: The index of the column being read (0-based).

member.name: P:Cesil.ReadContext.ColumnName
member.summary: The name of the column being read, can be null if no column names were available.

member.name: P:Cesil.ReadContext.Context
member.summary: The object, if any, provided to the call to CreateReader or CreateAsyncReader that produced the reader which is performing the read operation which is described by this context.

member.name: M:Cesil.ReadContext.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this ReadContext.

member.name: T:Cesil.ReadHeaders
member.summary:
Whether to expect a header row when deserializing.
This can be determined automatically with Detect.

member.name: F:Cesil.ReadHeaders.None
member.summary: Default value, do not use.

member.name: F:Cesil.ReadHeaders.Never
member.summary: Reading will fail if headers are present.

member.name: F:Cesil.ReadHeaders.Always
member.summary: Reading will fail if headers are _not_ present.

member.name: F:Cesil.ReadHeaders.Detect
member.summary: Will probe for headers, but will continue if they are not present.

member.name: T:Cesil.ReadResult`1
member.summary: Represents the result of an attempted read operation.

member.name: P:Cesil.ReadResult`1.HasValue
member.summary:
True if a value was read, false if not.
If false, there are no more rows to be read.

member.name: P:Cesil.ReadResult`1.Value
member.summary: The value read, if HasValue == true.

member.name: T:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter
member.summary:
The default implementation of IDynamicTypeConverter used to determine how to map a dynamic cell or row to a concrete type.
It will map cells to types using DeserializableMember.GetDefaultParser() or a constructor that takes a ReadOnlySpan(char).
It will map rows to Tuple, ValueTuple, IEnumerable(T), IEnumerable, user defined types with constructors of the same arity as the row, user defined types with a constructor taking a single object/dynamic, or user defined types where column names match properties and a zero-parameter constructor is defined.

member.name: T:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.ConstructorWithParameters
member.summary:
Represents a constructor - columns pair.
Used by GetRowConstuctorTakingTypedParameters to indicate a constructor to invoke with particular column values to map a dynamic row to a concrete type.

member.name: P:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.ConstructorWithParameters.Constructor
member.summary: Constructor to invoke.

member.name: P:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.ConstructorWithParameters.ColumnIndexes
member.summary: Indexes of the columns to pass to Constructor.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.ConstructorWithParameters.#ctor(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Create a new ConstructorWithParameters with the given constructor and columns.

member.name: T:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.ConstructorWithSetters
member.summary:
Represents a constructor - setters - columns triple.
Used by GetRowConstructorAndSetters to indicate a constructor to invoke to create a type, and then a series of setters to invoke and pass columns at the corresponding indexes to.

member.name: P:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.ConstructorWithSetters.Constructor
member.summary: Constructor to invoke.

member.name: P:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.ConstructorWithSetters.Setters
member.summary: Setters to invoke with column values.

member.name: P:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.ConstructorWithSetters.ColumnIndexes
member.summary: Indexes of the columns to pass to each setter.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.ConstructorWithSetters.#ctor(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Reflection.MethodInfo},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Create a new ConstructorWithParameters with the given constructor and columns.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.#ctor
member.summary:
Create a new instance of DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.
A pre-allocated instances can be found on DynamicTypeConverters.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.GetCellConverter(System.Int32,System.String,System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary: Returns a DynamicCellConverter that can be used to parse the targetType, if a default parser for the type exists or a constructor accepting ReadOnlySpan(char) is on the the type.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.GetCellParsingMethodFor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the default cell parsing method for the given type, if any.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.GetCellConstructorFor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the default constructor for the given type, if any.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.GetRowConverter(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String[],System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary: Returns a DynamicRowConverter that can be used to parse the targetType, if a default parser for the type exists or a constructor accepting the appropriate number of objects (can be dynamic in source) is on the the type.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.GetRowParsingMethodFor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String[],System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the default parsing method for the given type, if any, that maps a whole row to the given type.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.GetRowConstructorTakingDynamicFor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String[],System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the single-object-taking constructor for the given type (or one assignable to it), if any, that maps a whole row to the given type.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.GetRowConstuctorTakingTypedParameters(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String[],System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Returns a constructor and an array of column indexes that corresponds to a constructor on the given type (or one assignable to it) that takes typed parameters for each of the included columns.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.GetRowConstructorAndSetters(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String[],System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Returns a constructor, setters, and an array of column indexes that corresponds to the setters that takes typed parameters for each of the included columns.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: T:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber
member.summary:
The default implementation of ITypeDescriber used to determine how to (de)serialize a type.
It will serialize all public properties, any fields with a [DataMember], and will respect ShouldSerialize() methods.
It will deserialize all public properties, any fields with a [DataMember], and will call Reset() methods. Expects a public parameterless constructor for any deserialized types.
This type is unsealed to allow for easy extension of it's behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.#ctor
member.summary:
Construct a new DefaultTypeDesciber.
A pre-allocated instance is available on TypeDescribers.Default.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetInstanceBuilder(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Gets an InstanceBuilder that wraps the parameterless constructor for the given type.
Throws if there is no parameterless constructor.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.EnumerateMembersToDeserialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary: Enumerate all columns to deserialize.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.ShouldDeserialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns true if the given property should be deserialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetDeserializationName(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the name of the column that should map to the given property when deserialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetSetter(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the setter to use for the given property when deserialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetParser(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the parser to use for the column that maps to the given property when deserialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetPosition(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the index of the column that should map to the given property. Headers can change this during deserialization.
Return null to leave order unspecified.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetIsRequired(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns whether or not the given property is required during deserialization.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetReset(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the reset method, if any, to call prior to deserializing the given property.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.ShouldDeserialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns true if the given field should be deserialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetDeserializationName(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the name of the column that should map to the given field when deserialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetParser(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the parser to use for the column that maps to the given property when deserialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetPosition(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the index of the column that should map to the given field. Headers can change this during deserialization.
Return null to leave order unspecified.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetIsRequired(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns whether or not the given field is required during deserialization.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetReset(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the reset method, if any, to call prior to deserializing the given field.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.EnumerateMembersToSerialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary: Enumerate all columns to deserialize.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.ShouldSerialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns true if the given property should be serialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetSerializationName(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the name of the column that should map to the given property when serialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetGetter(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the getter to use for the given property when serialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetShouldSerializeMethod(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the ShouldXXX()-style method to use for the given property when serializing, if any.
If specified, the method will be invoked for each record to determine whether to write the property.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetFormatter(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the formatter to use for the column that maps to the given property when serialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetEmitDefaultValue(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary:
Returns whether or not the default value should be serialized for the given property.
For reference types, the default value is `null`. For ValueTypes the default value is either 0 or the equivalent of initializing all of it's fields with their default values.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.ShouldSerialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns true if the given field should be serialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetSerializationName(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the name of the column that should map to the given field when serialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetShouldSerializeMethod(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the ShouldXXX()-style method to use for the given field when serializing, if any.
If specified, the method will be invoked for each record to determine whether to write the field.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetFormatter(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns the formatter to use for the column that maps to the given field when serialized.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: M:Cesil.DefaultTypeDescriber.GetEmitDefaultValue(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary:
Returns whether or not the default value should be serialized for the given property.
For reference types, the default value is `null`. For ValueTypes the default value is either 0 or the equivalent of initializing all of it's fields with their default values.
Override to tweak behavior.

member.name: T:Cesil.DeserializableMember
member.summary: Represents a member of a type to use when deserializing.

member.name: P:Cesil.DeserializableMember.Name
member.summary: The name of the column that maps to this member.

member.name: M:Cesil.DeserializableMember.GetDefaultParser(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary: Returns the default parser for the given type, if any exists.

member.name: M:Cesil.DeserializableMember.ForProperty(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Creates a DeserializableMember for the given property.

member.summary: Creates a DeserializableMember for the given property, with the given name and parser.

member.summary: Creates a DeserializableMember for the given property, with the given name, parser, and whether it is required.

member.summary: Creates a DeserializableMember for the given property, with the given name, parser, whether it is required, and a reset method.

member.name: M:Cesil.DeserializableMember.ForField(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Creates a DeserializableMember for the given field.

member.summary: Creates a DeserializableMember for the given field, with the given name.

member.summary: Creates a DeserializableMember for the given field, with the given name and parser.

member.name: M:Cesil.DeserializableMember.ForField(System.Reflection.FieldInfo,System.String,System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a DeserializableMember for the given property, with the given name, parser, and whether it is required.

member.name: M:Cesil.DeserializableMember.ForField(System.Reflection.FieldInfo,System.String,System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Boolean,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Creates a DeserializableMember for the given property, with the given name, parser, whether it is required, and a reset method.

member.name: M:Cesil.DeserializableMember.Create(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.String,System.Reflection.FieldInfo,System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Boolean,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Create a DeserializableMember with an explicit name, backing field, parser, whether it is required, and a reset method.

member.name: M:Cesil.DeserializableMember.Create(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.String,System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Boolean,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Create a Deserializable member with an explicit name, setter, parser, whether it is required, and a reset method.

member.name: M:Cesil.DeserializableMember.ToString
member.summary:
Describes this DeserializableMember.
This is provided for debugging purposes, and the format is not guaranteed to be stable between releases.

member.name: T:Cesil.DynamicCellConverter
member.summary:
Describes how to convert a dynamic cell value into an instance of a type.
Conversions can implemented as constructors, or static methods.

member.name: M:Cesil.DynamicCellConverter.ForConstructor(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo)
member.summary:
Create a DynamicCellConverter from the given constructor.
Constructor must take a ReadOnlySpan(char).

member.name: M:Cesil.DynamicCellConverter.ForMethod(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary:
Create a DynamicCellConverter from the given method.
Method must be static, return a bool, take a ReadOnlySpan(char) as it's first parameter, a ReadContext as it's second parameter, and have a third parameter that is an out for the result value.

member.name: T:Cesil.DynamicRowConverter
member.summary:
Describes how to convert a dynamic row value into an instance of a type.
Conversions can implemented as constructors taking a single dynamic/object, constructors taking typed parameters, an empty constructor paired with setter methods, or static methods.

member.name: M:Cesil.DynamicRowConverter.ForConstructorTakingDynamic(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo)
member.summary:
Create a DynamicRowConverter from the given constructor.
Constructor must take an object (which can be dynamic in source).

member.name: M:Cesil.DynamicRowConverter.ForConstructorTakingTypedParameters(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Create a DynamicRowConverter for the given constructor, which maps specific columns to the parameters for the of the constructor.
Constructor must take the same number of parameters as column indexes passed in.

member.name: M:Cesil.DynamicRowConverter.ForEmptyConstructorAndSetters(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Reflection.MethodInfo},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Create a DynamicRowConverter for the given zero parameter constructor, which will call each setter with the column indicated in the passed column to setters.
The same number of setters and columns must be passed. Setter methods must take a single parameter, and either be callable on the constructed type or static. Setters must return void.

member.name: M:Cesil.DynamicRowConverter.ForMethod(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary:
Create a DynamicRowConverter from the given method.
Method must be static, return a bool, take an object (which can be dynamic in source) as it's first parameter, a ReadContext as it's second paramter, and have a third parameter that is an out for the result value.

member.name: T:Cesil.DynamicTypeConverters
member.summary: Holds references to pre-allocated DynamicTypeConverters.

member.name: F:Cesil.DynamicTypeConverters.Default
member.summary:
An instance of DefaultDynamicTypeConverter.
This instance is used in cases where an IDynamicTypeConverter has not been configured.

member.name: T:Cesil.IDynamicTypeConverter
member.summary: The interface used to discover how to convert dynamically typed values to concrete types.

member.name: M:Cesil.IDynamicTypeConverter.GetCellConverter(System.Int32,System.String,System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Called to determine how to convert a cell in the given column, as identified by it's number (base-0) and column name (which may be null), into the given type.
Column name will be null if headers were not configured or discovered during reading.

member.name: M:Cesil.IDynamicTypeConverter.GetRowConverter(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String[],System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Called to determine how to convert an entire row into the given type, as identified by it's number (base-0), into the given type.
Column names will be null if headers were not configured or discovered during reading.

member.name: T:Cesil.InstanceBuilderDelegate`1
member.summary: Delegate used to create InstanceBuilders.

member.name: T:Cesil.InstanceBuilder
member.summary: Represents a way to create new instances of a type.

member.name: M:Cesil.InstanceBuilder.ForParameterlessConstructor(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo)
member.summary:
Create a new InstanceBuilder from a parameterless constructor.
The constructed type must be concrete, that is: - not an interface - not an abstract class - not a generic parameter - not an unbound generic type (ie. a generic type definition)

member.name: M:Cesil.InstanceBuilder.ForDelegate``1(Cesil.InstanceBuilderDelegate{``0})
member.summary:
Create a new InstanceBuilder from delegate.
There are no restrictions on what the give delegate may do, but be aware that it may be called from many different contexts.

member.name: T:Cesil.ITypeDescriber
member.summary:
The interface used to discover the members to (de)serialize for a type.
DefaultTypeDescriber, ManualTypeDescriber, and SurrogateTypeDescriber all implement this interface and handle the most common desired configurations.

member.name: M:Cesil.ITypeDescriber.GetInstanceBuilder(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary: Get the builder used to make instances of forType.

member.name: M:Cesil.ITypeDescriber.EnumerateMembersToSerialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary: Enumerate all the members on forType to serialize.

member.name: M:Cesil.ITypeDescriber.EnumerateMembersToDeserialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary: Enumerate all the members on forType to deserialize.

member.name: T:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber
member.summary: An ITypeDescriber that takes lets you register explicit members to return when one of the EnumerateXXX() methods are called.

member.name: P:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber.ThrowsOnNoConfiguredType
member.summary: Whether to throw an exception if a type has no configured members for a given EnumerateXXX() method call.

member.name: M:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new ManualTypeDescriber.

member.name: M:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber.#ctor
member.summary:
Creates a new ManualTypeDescriber.
Does not throw if no type is configured for a given enumeration.

member.name: M:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber.SetExplicitParameterlessConstructor(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo)
member.summary: Set the parameterless constructor to use when constructing new instances of the constructor's declaring type.

member.name: M:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber.SetExplicitParameterlessConstructor(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo)
member.summary: Set the parameterless constructor to use when constructing new instances of the given type.

member.name: M:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber.SetBuilderDelegate``1(Cesil.InstanceBuilderDelegate{``0})
member.summary: Set the delegate to use when constructing new instances of type T.

member.name: M:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber.SetBuilderDelegate``1(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,Cesil.InstanceBuilderDelegate{``0})
member.summary: Set the delegate to use when constructing new instances of the given type.

member.name: M:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber.GetInstanceBuilder(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Returns an InstanceBuilder that can construct the given type.
If neither a parameterless constructor nor a delegate has been configured, will throw an exception.
If both a parameterless constructor and a delegate have been configured, will also throw an exception.

member.name: M:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber.EnumerateMembersToDeserialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Enumerate all the members on forType to deserialize.
If no members have been added for deserialization, will either return an empty enumerable or throw an exception based on the value of ThrowsOnNoConfiguredType.

member.name: M:Cesil.ManualTypeDescriber.EnumerateMembersToSerialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Enumerate all the members on forType to serialize.
If no members have been added for serialization, will either return an empty enumerable or throw an exception based on the value of ThrowsOnNoConfiguredType.

member.summary: Represents a member of a type to use when serializing.

member.name: P:Cesil.SerializableMember.Name
member.summary: The name of the column that maps to this member.

member.summary: Returns the default formatter for the given type, if one exists.

member.summary:
Describes this SerializableMember.
This is provided for debugging purposes, and the format is not guaranteed to be stable between releases.

member.name: T:Cesil.SurrogateTypeDescriber
member.summary:
A ITypeDesciber that enumerates members on a surrogate type and maps them to another type.
Used when you don't control the type you need to (de)serialize - you markup the surrogate type and then the uncontrolled type is (de)serialized as if it were the surrogate type.

member.name: P:Cesil.SurrogateTypeDescriber.TypeDescriber
member.summary: The type describer to use when enumerating on a surrogate type.

member.name: P:Cesil.SurrogateTypeDescriber.ThrowOnNoRegisteredSurrogate
member.summary:
Whether to throw when no surrogate type is registered for a type that is being described.
If false, types with no registered surrogate types are described by TypeDescriber.

member.name: M:Cesil.SurrogateTypeDescriber.#ctor(Cesil.ITypeDescriber,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new SurrogateTypeDescriber.

member.name: M:Cesil.SurrogateTypeDescriber.#ctor(Cesil.ITypeDescriber)
member.summary:
Create a new SurrogateTypeDescriber, using the given ITypeDescriber.
Does not throw if no surrogate is registered for an enumerated type.

member.name: M:Cesil.SurrogateTypeDescriber.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Create a new SurrogateTypeDescriber, using the given ITypeDescriber.
Uses TypeDescribers.Default as it's inner ITypeDescriber.

member.name: M:Cesil.SurrogateTypeDescriber.AddSurrogateType(System.Reflection.TypeInfo,System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Registered a surrogate type for forType.
Whenever forType is passed to one of the EnumerateXXX methods, surrogateType will be used to discover members instead. The discovered members will then be mapped to forType, and returned.

member.name: M:Cesil.SurrogateTypeDescriber.EnumerateMembersToDeserialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Enumerate all the members on forType to deserialize.
If a surrogate is registered, the surrogate will be used for discovery - the returned members will be mapped from the surrogate to forType.
If a surrogate is not registered, either an exception will be thrown or forType will be passed to TypeDescriber.EnumerateMembersToDeserialize depending on the value of ThrowOnNoRegisteredSurrogate.

member.name: M:Cesil.SurrogateTypeDescriber.EnumerateMembersToSerialize(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Enumerate all the members on forType to serialize.
If a surrogate is registered, the surrogate will be used for discovery - the returned members will be mapped from the surrogate to forType.
If a surrogate is not registered, either an exception will be thrown or forType will be passed to TypeDescriber.EnumerateMembersToSerialize depending on the value of ThrowOnNoRegisteredSurrogate.

member.name: M:Cesil.SurrogateTypeDescriber.GetInstanceBuilder(System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Gets an instance builder usable to construct the given type.
If a surrogate is registered, the surrogate will be used for discovery - the returned constructor will be mapped from the surrogate to forType.
If a surrogate is not registered, either an exception will be thrown or forType will be passed to TypeDescriber.GetInstanceBuilder depending on the value of ThrowOnNoRegisteredSurrogate.

member.name: T:Cesil.TypeDescribers
member.summary: Holds references to pre-allocated TypeDescibers.

member.name: F:Cesil.TypeDescribers.Default
member.summary:
An instance of DefaultTypeDescriber.
This instance is used in cases where an ITypeDescriber has not been configured.

member.name: T:Cesil.WriteContext
member.summary: Context object provided during write operations.

member.name: P:Cesil.WriteContext.RowNumber
member.summary: The index of the row being written (0-based).

member.name: P:Cesil.WriteContext.ColumnNumber
member.summary: The index of the column being written (0-based).

member.name: P:Cesil.WriteContext.ColumnName
member.summary: The name of the column being written, can be null if no column names are available.

member.name: P:Cesil.WriteContext.Context
member.summary: The object, if any, provided to the call to CreateWriter or CreateAsyncWriter that produced the writer which is performing the writer operation which is described by this context.

member.name: M:Cesil.WriteContext.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this WriteContext.
